title: Is materialism distancing us from nature? - Quora

response.answer_text: In a way, yes! it is. What makes me say that. Well what is nature? It ain't just about the green fields out there. It's our surroundings, our existence. Now assume, that the power goes down. No TV's, no WI-FI, no video games. At this juncture, one shouldn't be restless, you can simply stand in the balcony enjoy the wind, sing aloud, do whatever comes in your head. Whereas we might actually come across agitation, anxiety or irritation inside the human head.Why? Can't we spend some good time without something material to hold, see or work on. We can! Please don't make me realize that the next thing towards extinction .... are playgrounds!!!

A Big S. At the first instance it makes a person to be self-centered and self-oriented thus the very basic nature of being HUMAN leaves you in the pursuit of absolute materialism. The more sophisticated you become by invention after invention and this endangers not only the current ecological balance but also the generations to come. Take Ozone-hole or global melting apart from new diseases from AIDS to EBOLA which we never heard about.
